title.narrative: Yes We Can Initiative- My Safe Space

description.narrative:
Yes We Can Sustainable Leadership for Youth Initiative (Yes We Can) Project Summary:
The UN ranks Nigeria as 152nd out of 188 UN member States in Human Development Index. This is indeed a sad situation especially for the poor (which will include majority of the citizens). The situation is more profound amongst the most marginalized citizens like youths. Majority of Nigerian youths have been pushed beyond limit by frustration from bad government, failed social system and irresponsible leaders. Some of these frustration ismanifested in many ways such as- the recent increase in drug abuse all over the country leading to ban on the use of Codein in the country; suicidal journey to Europe through Sahara desert, persistent increase in armed groups led by youths- an avenue to vent their anger against the government etc. #Yes we can Youth Initiative# is aware of the enormous problem facing Nigerian youths; we know that a lot of them are seeking for direction, someone to listen to them, someone to amplify their voices, but more importantly, for a safe space where they can open up on these issues confidently and freely without being judged, a space where they can channel their youthful energy into something more positive. This is the situation #My safe Space#project aims to respond to.
#This project is all about bringing young people together in a safe space where they are free to express their thoughts, share their fears and worries; their experiences and success stories; and inspire each other. This space will create opportunity for youths to explore their potentials in the areas of arts and sports. It is all about inner self-empowerment, discovering exciting ways to look at life and deal with issues without dwelling on challenges of life. Some of the issues that this platform targets are: 1. Unemployment as it affectsthem 2. Their sexuality and sexual abuse 3. Unresponsive government to issues affecting youths 4. Conflicts at home, schools and neighbourhood
This space will allow them to discussthese issues, express their thoughts and proffer solutions on how to deal with it.Outcome of this engagement will be documented and used as an inspiration book to guide Nigerian youth, advocate for better policiesfor the youths and for upscale of the project in other states. To channel their energy to something more positive, the projectwill divide them into 3 groups and support them to engage in activities designated for their selected group: a. Reading and/writing group: they will select a set of inspirational books and share what they learnt with others on the next #my space# gathering b. Dancing: a professional will be hired to support this group. Dancing is a way of expressing freedom and a great way to deal with negative energy. It is also hopedthat it will open up career opportunities for some of them c. Advocacy group: developing campaign strategies and messages to push out outcomes of the conversations coming from the platform to policy makers.
This project will target 100 unemployed youths from poor slums.

participating-org.narrative:
YWC Youth initiative is a youth led organization operating at grassroots level. We have been in operation for over 10 years but have depended on donations from wealthy members of the community to support youth activities. Over the years, we have gained recognition by the state and local authorities in Enugu State as a focal point for youth mobilization and engagement. Most undergraduates and graduates in Enugu State identify with us because we have engaged with them at some point when they were in the University. We also reach out to urban poor- where we have more popularity, as they see us a channel of light in their lives.
Below are our 2 main achievements in Enugu State, our project focal State: 1. Our successful engagement with Enugu State Government during the #Grow your Own# agricultural initiative when we mobilized youths that benefited (farm <(>&<)> harvesting skills; distribution of farm crops and tools) from the state government initiative. This initiative was a result of YWC Youth Initiative#s advocacy to the State Government that the high rate of youth unemployment is driving our youths into violence and unpatriotic acts
2. Massive mobilization of Asata youths to support the clean-up exercise at Artisan Market when hygiene of the popular market became a topical issue. The local government authority approached YWC Youth initiative for this support and we liked the idea because we believe always that it is better toengage the youths positively than allow them wander about with no means. This exercise was seen as civic responsibility, but a lot of them got state and local government job appointment as a result of it.
Our Project Team includes:
Miss Amanda Okolie- a young woman with passion in mobilizing youths, started from her University days when she participated in students# Union governance. Amandagraduated with 1st class in Nutritional Biochemistry. She will be the project coordinator of #My Safe Space# project
Mrs FranciscaOgolo- a graduate of Sociology who has keen interest in youth activities. She was a very active member of ESUT University Student Union and have also gathered lots of program experience as the program focal person for YWC Youth Initiative projects in the past. She will be 100% on this project as the program officer
Mr. Ifeanyi Nnamani: Fresh graduate in public administration with interest infinance and accounting. He will be the finance officer in the project
Miss Oluchukwu Edeh- program support staff of YWC youth initiative hwo provides administrative support in all YWC Youth Initiative projects. She will be the project support staff in this project
Our Board of Trustees: Ms Ngozi Asogwa- 08032717405; ngozikasogwa@yahoo.com Ms Nneka Eze- 08036262096; judith2eze@yahoo.com Ms Obiageli Uzoma- 08037417153; evelynuzoma90@gmail.com Mr. Uchenna Ani- 08069167324; uchennavagwu@yahoo.com Mr. Azubuike Ogolo- 07081000250; azubuikeogolo22@gmail.com
We believe in the Youths, we are young, we know we can do all things if we set our mind to it
Yes We Can Sus. Leadership-Youth In
